page.title: 20Mortimers Provision for Aged
page.content: Windmill Court is being built. It will be wardened, making provison for 16 heavily dependent residents, plus 37 sheltered residents. Heathfield will continue to be an old people's home (up-graded) although many will move from there to Windmill Court. Mortimer House, formerly for blind,now also has sighted residents. It will be sold as soon as Windmill Court is operative. Glenapp Grange has just been converted to private flats for retired (Â£32,000 to Â£53,000). Burghfield Volunteer Bureau (formed 1974) helps elderly with hospital journeys, decorating, shopping, etc. Mortimer Age Concern is active too in trying to meet the needs (mainly financial) of the elderly in the village. Children from St. John's regularly contact O.A.P.'s (especially those living alone) at times like Christmas,Harvest Festival,and May Day
